issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

assignee.name: myrna

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

author.name: myrna
author.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

comments.body:
This is a result of my patch for DERBY-892. 
I didn't notice the hang with derbyall in my windows env, and the test didn't show up as failed...but rechecking on linux I saw this.

The solution is to add a testProtocol.policy file with the required permission. I will do so this afternoon (and test on both platforms to be sure).

updateAuthor.name: myrna
updateAuthor.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

author.name: myrna
author.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

comments.body:
I attached a patch - DERBY-1334_20060520.diff - which adds testProtocol.policy.

I reverified the hang in this test before this fix on a Solaris box, and verified the problem doesn't occur with this fix.

updateAuthor.name: myrna
updateAuthor.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

author.name: fuzzylogic
author.emailAddress: mcintyre dot a at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Committed to trunk with revision 408077.

Should this be marked regression? Or assigned to regression test failure component?

updateAuthor.name: fuzzylogic
updateAuthor.emailAddress: mcintyre dot a at gmail dot com

author.name: myrna
author.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

comments.body: Actually, it *is* marked test regression component. so, removing the 'regression' check.

updateAuthor.name: myrna
